segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s standing in a puddle, but her face is so calm, like she’s in another world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the edge, soaking the cabinets and spreading across the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it’s been like this and why she hasn’t noticed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids behind her are up to something, but she’s too focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost hear the dripping sound mixing with the clinking of dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like watching a slow-motion disaster unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout at her to turn off the faucet before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But she just keeps wiping that plate, completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, like a mocking contrast to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR
